result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Xavier Sevilla

defendant.name: Sevilla, Xavier
defendant.address: Lincoln Hills School, W4380 Copper Lake Avenue, Irma, WI 54442

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Xavier Sevilla not in Court, in custody.  Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn appeared by video for Xavier Sevilla.  Attorney Chad Wozniak and Daniel T Flaherty appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Status hearing. Court addressed Defendant's custody status. Defense confirmed. Discussion placed on the record. Defense provided an update to the Court regarding discovery material. Defense requested a plea date. State to comply with Victim Notification. Statements by J.B. Court ordered case adjourned for Plea hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 

Plea hearing scheduled for January 6, 2023 at 11:00 am. Hearing will be held IN-PERSON in Room 113 of the Safety Building. 
STATE MUST FILE AN ORDER TO PRODUCE.

Defendant Xavier Sevilla appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn appeared by video for Xavier Sevilla.  Attorney Chad Wozniak appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

**JUDGE FEISS AND ALL PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.** 
Case in Court for Status hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Defense received Discovery materials from the State. Defense requested additional time to review digital Discovery material with Defendant. Court held colloquy with Defendant regarding No Contact order.  Court ordered case adjourned for Status hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 

Status hearing scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 9:00am. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.

Court ordered no contact with I.A., J.C.B., E.G, T.R.G., E.M.O CRUZ, R.M.O, G.T III, K.A.T and Mayfair Mall
No Contact/No Firearms/ Dangerous Weapons Order, signed and filed.

ADDRESS INFO for Xavier Sevilla
Current: Lincoln Hills School, W4380 Copper Lake Avenue, Irma, WI 54442 United States  (Effective: 08-15-2022)

Lincoln Hills contacted the Court via email regarding Defendant's contact information.
Lincoln Hills was added so Defendant can receive pertinent case information. 
Defendant's home address was also updated.

ADDRESS INFO for Xavier Sevilla
Current: Lincoln Hills School 
Prior: 1937 South Layton Boulevard, Milwaukee, WI 53215

Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn in court, defendant Xavier Sevilla not in court, in custody. Daniel T Flaherty appeared on behalf of Chad Wozniak for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Status hearing. Defense appeared via Zoom Video Conference. Defendant was not produced for hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Defense received discovery material. Defense requested a Status hearing to allow time to review Discovery materials. State did not object. Court will address No Contact Order at the next hearing.
Court ordered case adjourned for Status hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Scheduling Conference scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 9:30 am. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Case adjourned to Br.46.

Defendant Xavier Sevilla in court with Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn.  Defendant Xavier Sevilla in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State:Detective Kirk Will    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 4.
 Effective 08-01-2020, this calendar will be reassigned to Judge Jeffrey Wagner, Branch 38, room 504 of the Courthouse.Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Hanrahan.  
Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Feiss, Br. 46.
  Status conference scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring. 24 hour curfew. No alternative for GPS conditions. GPS is mandatory even if bond is posted. Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Xavier Sevilla in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Defendant Xavier Sevilla in custody at Lincoln Hills.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Xavier Sevilla appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count(s) 9 and 10. Commissioner advised if DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant Court orders the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant. Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).   
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
